required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Healing Effects of HP802-247 Versus Antibiotic Ointment in Mohs Micrographic Surgery Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Randomized, Open-label Study Investigating the Healing Effects of HP802-247 Versus Antibiotic Ointment in Mohs Micrographic Surgery Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares HP802-247 versus an antibiotic ointment for healing the wound after Mohs surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: The Primary Efficacy Measure Was the Investigator's Global Assessment of Healing (IGAH).
primary_outcome.time_frame: 13 weeks- The IGAH was measured at study Weeks 4 and 13
primary_outcome.description: The IGAH is a four-point scale based on the following assessment scores: 0 = not effective, 1 = slightly effective, 2 = moderately effective, 3 = very effective. The descriptive statistics for both a continuous variable and a categorical variable were summarized for IGAH by treatment week and treatment endpoint. The Wilcoxon rank-sum test was used to test the difference in IGAH score between HP802-247 and bacitracin ointment for each treatment week and treatment endpoint. Since this was a small and exploratory study, the P-value of a 1-sided test was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Subjects With Complete Wound Closure at Each Evaluation Visit.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Over 12 weeks or until wound closure, which ever occurred first. Following completion of treatment subjects were followed for a further 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Complete wound closure was assessed at each evaluation visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time in Days to Wound Closure
secondary_outcome.description: The Kaplan-Meier survival analysis was used to calculate the mean time in days to complete wound closure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At each evaluation visit: Weeks 3 and 12 post-surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator reported signs and/or symptoms, based on the following 12 items, each scored as none (=0), mild (=1), moderate (=2), or severe (=3): Erythema, Erosion, Ulceration, Swelling, Scarring, Infection, Crusting, Necrosis, Peeling, Contact Dermatitis, Hyper/Hypopigmentation. Item scores were averaged.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At each evaluation visit: Weeks 3, and 12 post-surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects reported signs or symptoms, based on the following 6 items, each scored as none (=0), mild (=1), moderate (=2), or severe (=3): irritation, itchiness, burning, tenderness, pain, and stinging. Item scores were averaged.

arm_group.description: allogeneic, growth arrested keratinocytes and fibroblasts: final concentration of 5.0 M cells/mL with a ratio of 1:9 keratinocytes:fibroblasts, applied weekly

intervention.description: High dose HP 802-247, applied at each visit (Week 1-13) or until healed
One dose of Bacitracin ointment consists of 50 units/1 gram. This will be applied daily for 12 weeks (or until healed).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provide informed consent.
- Age ≥ 18 years and of either sex.
- Type I, II, or III skin as assessed by the Fitzpatrick Scale.
- Willing to comply with protocol instructions, including allowing all study assessments.
- Scheduled to have head or neck non-melanoma skin cancers removed by Mohs micrographic surgery with final wound size of 8 mm to 20 mm in diameter or with 8 mm to 20 mm long axis if not circular.
- Acceptable state of health and nutrition, in the opinion of the Investigator.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of anaphylaxis, serum sickness, or erythema multiforme reaction to aprotinin, bovine serum albumin or bovine serum proteins, penicillin, streptomycin, or amphotericin B.
- Therapy with blood-thinning agents including aspirin within 14 days of the Baseline Visit (these may be resumed post-surgery).
- Subjects with platelet or coagulation disorders.
- Therapy with another investigational agent within thirty (30) days of Screening, or during the study.
- Current systemic therapy with cytotoxic drugs.
- Current therapy with chronic (> 10 days) oral corticosteroids.
- In the opinion of the Investigator the subject has a current life expectancy of less than 1 year.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were enrolled at a single US investigational site, between June 22, 2011and November 16, 2011
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects who met inclusion criteria returned for visit1 on the day of surgery and entered the study following. Subjects randomly assigned to HP802-247 or Bacitracin for post-surgical treatment, which lasted for up to 12 weeks or wound closure, which ever occurred first. Following completion of treatment subjects were followed for 4 weeks

group.description: allogeneic, growth arrested keratinocytes and fibroblasts: final concentration of 5.0 M cells/mL with a ratio of 1:9 keratinocytes:fibroblasts, applied weekly HP802-247: High dose HP 802-247, applied at each visit (Week 1-13) or until healed

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: The Primary Efficacy Measure Was the Investigator’s Global Assessment of Healing (IGAH).
outcome.description: The IGAH is a four-point scale based on the following assessment scores: 0 = not effective, 1 = slightly effective, 2 = moderately effective, 3 = very effective. The descriptive statistics for both a continuous variable and a categorical variable were summarized for IGAH by treatment week and treatment endpoint. The Wilcoxon rank-sum test was used to test the difference in IGAH score between HP802-247 and bacitracin ointment for each treatment week and treatment endpoint. Since this was a small and exploratory study, the P-value of a 1-sided test was reported.
outcome.time_frame: 13 weeks- The IGAH was measured at study Weeks 4 and 13
outcome.population: The ITT population – all subjects who underwent MMS.

group.title: HP802-247
group.description: allogeneic, growth arrested keratinocytes and fibroblasts: final concentration of 5.0 M cells/mL with a ratio of 1:9 keratinocytes:fibroblasts, applied weekly HP802-247: High dose HP 802-247, applied at each visit (Week 1-13) or until healed

group.title: Bacitracin Ointment
group.description: bacitracin antibiotic ointment Bacitracin Ointment: One dose of Bacitracin ointment consists of 50 units/1 gram. This will be applied daily for 12 weeks (or until healed).

measure.title: The Primary Efficacy Measure Was the Investigator’s Global Assessment of Healing (IGAH).
measure.description: The IGAH is a four-point scale based on the following assessment scores: 0 = not effective, 1 = slightly effective, 2 = moderately effective, 3 = very effective. The descriptive statistics for both a continuous variable and a categorical variable were summarized for IGAH by treatment week and treatment endpoint. The Wilcoxon rank-sum test was used to test the difference in IGAH score between HP802-247 and bacitracin ointment for each treatment week and treatment endpoint. Since this was a small and exploratory study, the P-value of a 1-sided test was reported.
measure.population: The ITT population – all subjects who underwent MMS.

outcome.title: The Number of Subjects With Complete Wound Closure at Each Evaluation Visit.
outcome.description: Complete wound closure was assessed at each evaluation visit.
outcome.time_frame: Over 12 weeks or until wound closure, which ever occurred first. Following completion of treatment subjects were followed for a further 4 weeks
outcome.population: The ITT population – all subjects who underwent MMS. Fisher’s exact test was used to examine the difference in proportion of subjects with complete wound closure at each of the corresponding time points between the two treatment groups, and the P-value of a 1-sided test was reported.

group.title: HP802-247
group.description: allogeneic, growth arrested keratinocytes and fibroblasts: final concentration of 5.0 M cells/mL with a ratio of 1:9 keratinocytes:fibroblasts, applied weekly HP802-247: High dose HP 802-247, applied at each visit (Week 1-13) or until healed

group.title: Bacitracin Ointment
group.description: bacitracin antibiotic ointment Bacitracin Ointment: One dose of Bacitracin ointment consists of 50 units/1 gram. This will be applied daily for 12 weeks (or until healed).

measure.title: The Number of Subjects With Complete Wound Closure at Each Evaluation Visit.
measure.description: Complete wound closure was assessed at each evaluation visit.
measure.population: The ITT population – all subjects who underwent MMS. Fisher’s exact test was used to examine the difference in proportion of subjects with complete wound closure at each of the corresponding time points between the two treatment groups, and the P-value of a 1-sided test was reported.

outcome.title: Time in Days to Wound Closure
outcome.description: The Kaplan-Meier survival analysis was used to calculate the mean time in days to complete wound closure.
outcome.population: The ITT population – all subjects who underwent MMS. The Log-rank test was used to test for an inter-group difference.

group.title: HP802-247
group.description: allogeneic, growth arrested keratinocytes and fibroblasts: final concentration of 5.0 M cells/mL with a ratio of 1:9 keratinocytes:fibroblasts, applied weekly HP802-247: High dose HP 802-247, applied at each visit (Week 1-13) or until healed

group.title: Bacitracin Ointment
group.description: bacitracin antibiotic ointment Bacitracin Ointment: One dose of Bacitracin ointment consists of 50 units/1 gram. This will be applied daily for 12 weeks (or until healed).

measure.title: Time in Days to Wound Closure
measure.description: The Kaplan-Meier survival analysis was used to calculate the mean time in days to complete wound closure.
measure.population: The ITT population – all subjects who underwent MMS. The Log-rank test was used to test for an inter-group difference.

outcome.title: Investigator Reported Signs and Symptoms
outcome.description: Investigator reported signs and/or symptoms, based on the following 12 items, each scored as none (=0), mild (=1), moderate (=2), or severe (=3): Erythema, Erosion, Ulceration, Swelling, Scarring, Infection, Crusting, Necrosis, Peeling, Contact Dermatitis, Hyper/Hypopigmentation. Item scores were averaged.
outcome.time_frame: At each evaluation visit: Weeks 3 and 12 post-surgery.
outcome.population: The ITT population–all subjects who underwent MMS. Both total score and individual item score of the two signs and symptoms rating scales summarized descriptively at Weeks 4, 7, and 13 as well as at the treatment endpoint and compared using a two-sample t-test. the P-value of a 1-sided test was reported.

reported_events.time_frame: Safety reporting occurred over the eight weeks of the study.
reported_events.desc: All subjects randomized to treatment were questioned about adverse events and were included in the number of participants assessed for safety. The first assessments at each visit were about changes in general health and concomitant medications and the occurrence of adverse events.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
